The Supreme Polarity is the boundless extremity ascending above Great Loftiness, named the Harmonious Florescence Heaven. *Primordial Brahma* refers to the Primordial Beginning’s wind and mist *qi*, uplifting and clarifying the Han River’s essence, high and pervading the void, suspended yet never falling. *Vast and boundless* describes that which is distant yet unimpeded, existent yet as if nonexistent, subtle beyond naming, wondrous beyond seeking. Profound and serene, within it lies the Perfected; within the Perfected, essence is born, delivering the practitioner’s body through the Six Brahma Practices. When one embodies the Six Brahma, their form transforms, roaming carefree above the Three Realms, wandering through Great Loftiness’ azure. Their names enter the Harmonious Florescence Heaven’s register, and their nine ancestors together ascend to Great Loftiness’ palace, receiving blessings within the Seven Treasures Grove.

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Dao Lord: When the great kalpa commences and the Crimson Clarity first dawns, the *qi* of the Eight Heavens is apportioned and bestowed, all belonging to the Northern Mystery Heaven. The eight characters combine into sixty-four tones, all constituting the Heavenly Great Brahma’s esoteric, boundless sounds. Practicing the Way of the Five *Qi* Heavenly Lords, one should bear these tones, recite this verse, and in all ingress and egress, constantly perform the Fivefold Tooth-Knocking, envisioning the luxuriant *Flying Tortoise Feather Canopy* swirling to the left and right, with threefold layers of mysterious clouds enveloping the body. Divine lads and jade maidens, clad in feathered robes and flying garments, attend before and behind. The secret incantation reads:

*Mystery Heaven’s meandering,*
*Flowing radiance ascends to the Upper Clarity.*
*Great Existence inaugurates the kalpa,*
*The eight characters soar in luminous clarity.*
*Flying Mystery settles the void,*
*Cavernous tones arise spontaneously.*
*Five Qi entwine,*
*Irrigating my form.*
*Crowned and girded in the Northern Singularity,*
*Receiving refinement in the Cavernous Numinous.*
*The Kidney Palace transforms into immortality,*
*Inner water gleams with essence.*
*Soaring through the Three Realms,*
*Roaming and feasting in the Purple Court.*
*Seven ancestors rejoice together,*
*Delighting in kalpic ages.*
*Within the Seven Treasures Grove,*
*Returning to the womb to renew the form.*
*Long night’s death extinguished,*
*Names recorded in the Southern Palace.*
*Yellow Registers and White Tallies,*
*Generation upon generation born as immortals.*

Upon completion, draw in the *qi* and swallow five times. Practicing this for five years, the Eight Heavens each dispatch five *Great Mystery Jade Lads* and *Jade Maidens* to attend the body, descending to bestow the essence of the *Mysterious Nourishment’s Five Qi*, halting aging and preserving the kalpa, safeguarding life within the Three Clarities. Seven ancestors rejoice together, generation upon generation born as immortals. This method is lofty and wondrous; treasure it deeply and do not treat it lightly.

The Dao Lord bowed his head and reverently received the decree.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign bowed and addressed the Heavenly Worthy: Since receiving the sun and moon, I have followed the kalpa’s flow, coming and going in the turning wheel. One radiance, one darkness; one extinction, one renewal; one death, one birth. The body endures destruction, one ruin and one completion. Traversing heaven and earth, light and brightness alternate. Profound and distant, beyond all conception.

Since the Dragon Han kalpa, ninety-nine million nine hundred and ninety thousand great kalpas have passed. Karmic ties entangle, generation after generation unbroken, even unto this day. I have been born into royal gates, and also into humble homes; into wealthy chambers, and also into destitute cold; into human nobility, and also as a servant; afflicted by the six illnesses, and also blessed with radiance; granted wisdom, and also stricken with foolish deafness. Having experienced all manner of existences, my body has yet to find peace. Evil karmic ties arise, leading to unrighteous conduct beyond human bounds: disrespecting heaven and earth, unafraid of ghosts and spirits, lacking compassion and filial piety, harming living beings. In death, I followed the Sword Tree, feet treading the Knife Mountain, entering the Frigid Night or the Cauldron’s Scalding Waters, dragged through the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, body and soul tormented, enduring every agony. After ten thousand kalpas of karmic suffering, I was reborn among the six livestock, my lifespan brief, only to face death and destruction again, then compelled to serve as a long-term laborer in the Five Peaks, toiling under the Eastern Peak, enduring every hardship. After a thousand kalpas of suffering, I was reborn among the frontier barbarians. Though possessing human form, I lacked human sentiment, my lifespan brief, my body perishing once more. My soul departed to the Four Rivers, tossed upon the dark waves, mired in filth and freezing ice, day and night without respite. After a hundred kalpas of karmic retribution, I was reborn among the lowly, afflicted by the six illnesses, hideously deformed, utterly detestable. My lifespan brief, I faced death again, my soul entering the Long Night’s Nine Glooms, conscripted to labor in the Three Rivers, damming the long sources, frostbite piercing the flesh, enduring every suffering. Only when all karmic ties were exhausted was I reborn among humankind, my form comely, my humanity complete. Yet my lifespan remained brief, and I faced death again, my soul returning to the Three Offices, driven to toil through a hundred hardships, wandering the ghostly courts. After ten thousand years, my sins were finally expiated, and I was reborn into a good family, lacking nothing in wealth and treasure, enjoying ease and comfort. Yet my lifespan remained brief, and I faced death again, my soul returning to the Three Offices as a benevolent ghost, appointed as a capital overseer, governing life and death. After a thousand years, my roots were severed, and I was reborn with penetrating spiritual vision, able to perceive ghosts and spirits, commanding and summoning them to aid the nation and save the people.

At times I aided emperors and kings in pacifying the four quarters, yet my lifespan remained brief, and I faced death again. My soul then became a companion and friend to the Five Emperors, consorting with divine immortals. After a hundred years, my karmic roots were dissolved together, my earthly banishment completed, and I was appointed as a general overseer of the Three Offices, my name recorded in the heavens. Thus I was reborn into the gates of wealth and nobility, into a household of kings and marquises. My glory and emoluments were boundless; when my roots were exhausted, blessings arose. I vowed great vows, dispersed alms to the destitute, and broadly performed meritorious deeds, thereby attaining extinction and ascending directly to heaven, where I roamed freely in joy, my clothing and food naturally provided. After twenty-four years, I was reborn into a noble household, receiving qi and wisdom, my five centers opened to understanding. I cultivated and upheld the scriptures and methods, disdaining wealth and honoring the Dao, my heart compassionate toward all. Reverent toward my teachers and treasures, my merits were not yet complete, and I again attained extinction, ascending to the Southern Palace. The Vermilion Numinance expunged my name from the registers of fate, and the Three Realms inscribed my merits and name. I wandered through the thirty-two heavens of the ten directions, consorting with the highest sages as a guest of the Most High. After ten years, I returned among humankind, my body becoming a master and patriarch, proclaiming and transmitting the Dharma’s sounds, opening the path to salvation for gods and humans, teaching and transforming all living beings. Through countless kalpas, I experienced all things—death, the servitude of the Three Offices, and the reckoning of my allotted years. Yet when my term neared its end, I once more harbored evil intentions, my sins exceeding the norm. I faced death again, returning to the Three Offices to confront my servitude and banishment, my suffering surpassing that of before. Thus, in a single kalpa, good and evil alternated, ease and urgency shifted, death and life succeeded one another, vexation and joy intermingled, and hardships and setbacks endured without end.

When all evil defilements were exhausted and blessings and virtue arose of themselves, I was once more reborn into the gates of wealth and nobility. Through the Dao’s karmic conditions, I made offerings to the scriptures and methods, invoking the Seven Treasures to reveal their numinosity. I vowed good intentions, and my merits and name were perfected, commended by the Three Realms and illuminated by the Five Emperors. Cloud chariots descended, and the eight-jewelled jade wheels carried me through the void, ascending at dawn beneath the white sun. I was enveloped in the Heavenly Worthy’s grace, my profound kindness repaid, my decayed form adorned. I beheld the light, transcended the Three Realms, and ascended to the rank of Heavenly Perfected. Today, seated in attendance, my joy is beyond words.

The Heavenly Worthy, not disdaining my former narrowness and incompetence in all matters, commanded me to take up my brush and expound the celestial sounds. Under the weight of this solemn teaching, I dared not conceal the truth, and so I have fully expressed all that I have witnessed, laying bare my heart. Though I have not elaborated in detail, I have traversed countless kalpas since former lives, roaming the celestial origins, following the Dharma through life and death. I have always encountered the true scriptures, yet I have not trodden the path of their mysterious transformation or penetrated their fundamental roots. Moved by my private limitations, I have earnestly presented this natural scripture to elucidate the text of profound kindness, to resonate with the sound of jade chimes, and to echo the tones of jasper and jade. Though its meaning is not entirely complete, it is sufficient to expound the roots of heaven and earth.

As for the vastness and constriction of the heavens, the transformations of their qi and phenomena, the sun, moon, and stars, the palaces, mountains, and forests, the cities and terraces of the Perfected, and the origins of the demon kings and spirits—these matters are profoundly abstruse and cannot be fully detailed. Moreover, the causes and conditions of questioning and difficulty have already been recorded in ancient texts, and I shall not reiterate them one by one to avoid prolixity and burden.

Now I have roughly explained the meaning of the celestial scripture’s Fivefold Union. This Dao is sufficient to open the path to salvation for gods and humans, to eradicate the roots of all suffering. The great Dharma unfolds, its blessings extending to the ten directions. In this life and the next, men and women of goodwill shall receive this grace.

According to the *Primordial Yang Jade Treasury*, as the Nine Heavens reckon the movements of fate, the numinous passes revolve in cycles. When the thirty-two heavens complete one revolution, false ways emerge, and the hearts of the myriad people are filled with deceit, all revering and upholding them together. This scripture shall return to the Great Canopy above, to the Seven Treasures Palace. When three or five cycles are complete and the power of the myriad ways is exhausted, the Great Sage shall arise in glory, descending to the world to save humanity. The false seats shall be abolished, the rebellious people subdued, the Dao and virtue shall flourish, and the world shall know great peace. The lord of the nation shall enjoy long reigns, and the ten directions shall be at rest. The true scriptures shall aid the world, and auspicious signs shall arise daily.

At the beginning of the *renzi* year, in the *yimao* year, during the *jiazi* decade, the Nine Varieties of Immortals of the Azure Emperor shall ride nine-colored dragons, emerging to roam Mount Tai, bearing this true scripture to sweep away inauspicious omens. When the true scripture descends to the world, the sounds of horns and dragons shall resound. Those who encounter this Dao shall strengthen their destiny, preserving the *jiashen* year, universally saving gods and humans. At that time, joy shall abound—such is the merit of this scripture. Those who uphold it shall enjoy blessings; those who cultivate it shall become immortals.

This text is profoundly mysterious, its vast embrace boundless. The great Dharma is revered and weighty. I humbly pray that the Heavenly Worthy shall universally proclaim it to the Emperors of the Heavens, the Great Sage Honored Spirits, the sun, moon, and stars, the deities above and below the earth, the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the Water Emperors of rivers and seas, the Perfected Immortals, the divine officials of the ten directions, and all worlds. May they, in accordance with the statutes of the Great Existence and the regulations of reverence and deference, forbid negligence and carelessness, and secretly uphold it.

At that moment, the Heavenly Worthy raised his hand and snapped his fingers. In the heavens above and below, on the earth above and below, and in the boundless worlds, all divine spirits secretly upheld it. The hosts of the Great Sages of the Heavens simultaneously bowed their heads and knelt, praising its goodness.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the assembly of Great Sages and the boundless Most High Lords of the Great Dao of the thirty-two heavens and the ten directions. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: Before the Dragon Han kalpa, during the Yan Kang era, I followed the movements of fate through life and death. When the Dragon Han arrived, I received karmic reckoning, my soul and form enduring hardships, suffering in the Three Offices. When my karma was exhausted and my roots severed, I entered the gates of blessings. I traversed heaven and earth, experiencing success and failure without limit, witnessing the celestial origins and always encountering the Numinous Treasure. In every generation, the Dharma emerged to transform and save gods and humans.

Thus, I thoroughly investigated the affairs of heaven and was able to explain the celestial scripture’s natural text. The great Dharma is now revealed, revered by all heavens. It is fitting to proclaim this ultimate principle, its sounds resounding clearly.

Thus, I commanded the brush to be taken up, to elucidate its intricate details, harmonizing the boundless sounds of the Five Directions to complete the formation of all heavens, universally delivering future lives. Within it lies profound mystery, truly worthy of reverence. Once the numinous sounds resound clearly, all heavens shine with radiance—above the heavens and below, upon the earth and beneath, throughout the ten directions and the infinite worlds—every divine spirit without exception venerates and upholds it.

Following the ancient statutes of the *Mingzhen Xuanke*, twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens are appointed to burn incense and attend the Perfected, inspecting negligence and correcting transgressions. It must not be lightly transmitted. Once every forty thousand kalpas, it descends to the world to deliver humanity. Be vigilant in its stewardship, ensuring no careless words are spoken.

At that moment, the four assemblies bowed as one, prostrating and praising its excellence. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign then declared: The celestial scripture is revered, delivering countless beings. Those who honor it gain blessings; those who slight it invite calamity. All the past Perfected, the boundless great sages of the heavens, the utmost true and venerable spirits, the flying celestial immortals, the divine immortals of the Five Peaks, and the transcendents of the sacred mountains—none fail to receive and revere the celestial scripture’s natural sounds, thereby attaining utmost perfection.

Unless one’s name is already inscribed in the Golden Register or the Jade Characters of the Upper Clarity, one shall never behold it. Should one, mired in carelessness and negligence, glimpse even its title, the spirit will be confounded, and enlightenment will remain forever closed. Only those with predestined affinity shall naturally awaken the heart, yearning for the divine scripture. Born in an age when it appears, encountering its text, one must present the pledge of seven-jeweled patterned silk, seek out a master, and swear an oath, reporting to the heavens above before receiving and wearing it upon the body.

Those who wear this scripture are revered by all heavens, praised by the Three Realms, attended by the Five Emperors, welcomed by earthly deities, and approached in homage by all divine spirits. It shall rescue the nine generations of ancestors from eternal night, deliver the dead souls from the nine shades, return them to the womb of numinous qi, and grant rebirth through the gates of wealth and nobility. Forever shall they wander among the heavens, lifted as guests of the Most High.

The Five Elder Thearchs proclaimed to all heavens, to the sacred mountains of the Five Peaks upon the earth, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the divine immortals, Perfected, Jade Maidens, and all divine spirits: The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign has unveiled the wondrous transformation of *Dàyǒu*, conveying the numinous scripture of nature. The celestial scripture is sacred and must not be lightly transmitted. Men and women of this generation who harbor no duplicity in their hearts and revere the natural shall receive it and ascend. Those who uphold it shall attain long life. Those who value the Dharma over wealth shall not speak of demonic obstacles.

Men and women of future generations, their hearts corrupted, each harboring deceit and cunning, prizing wealth and scorning the Dao, disbelieving in the utmost truth—even if they turn toward it, their devotion shall be superficial, their will divided, covetous and scheming, inviting demonic slander. Thus, the *Xuanke* decrees prohibitions, requiring seven-jeweled patterned silk to test the sincerity of the heart. For those true scholars who follow the statutes and present the precious pledge, their names shall be announced to the heavens, proclaimed to the Five Peaks, and recorded by the earthly immortals. They shall be reported to the demon kings, vouched for before the Three Clarities, and only then may transmission proceed. Those who violate the *Xuanke* shall bear the wind-blade upon their bodies, forever barred from return through ten thousand kalpas, their nine generations consigned to eternal night, eternally enslaved at the River Source. Let all divine spirits clearly heed these words.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign addressed the Five Elder Thearchs: In the midst of the Dragon Han kalpa, I received this scripture from the Eternally Abiding Lord of No-Name. According to the rites of reverence, I inscribed with cinnabar brush the eight celestial sounds, totaling two hundred fifty-six characters, upon yellow silk to be worn upon the body. Following the *Mingzhen Xuanke*, it is consecrated with the seven treasures—gold, silver, coral, lapis lazuli, giant clam, crystal, and agate. Forty feet of five-colored patterned silk are offered as the pledge of the divine statutes, never to be diminished.

For those of sincere heart who are destitute and unable to prepare the full offering, the essence of devotion must be preserved. The measure of their capacity shall determine what is fitting to bestow. In the first year of the *Shanghuang* era, on the *bingwu* day of the seventh month, the Queen Mother of the West taught this in the grotto chamber of Southern Florescence, transmitting it to the Perfected of Pure Emptiness, Lord Wang, who passed it to Yu. It was sealed within the stone crags of the Southern Florescence grotto chamber. When the great kalpa turns and fate shifts, it shall emerge into the world to deliver those who attain the Dao.

*The Fourth Scroll of the Jade Characters of the Numinous Treasure’s Inner Sounds of All Heavens, Spontaneously Arisen*

*The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Inner Sounds of the Various Heavens, Spontaneously Manifested in Jade Characters*

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Inner Sounds of the Various Heavens, Spontaneously Manifested in Jade Characters*. Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. One of the ancient *Scriptures of the Numinous Treasure*. Originally in two scrolls, later divided into four. Base text from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Cavernous Truth* section, *Jade Instructions* category. Collated with the Dunhuang manuscript fragment P.2431.

---

**Scroll One of *The Supreme Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Scripture of the Inner Sounds of the Various Heavens, Spontaneously Manifested in Jade Characters***

### *The Jade Instructions of the Great Brahma’s Hidden Language and the Infinite Cavernous Chapters*

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign declared: *"The Jade Characters of the Heavenly Scripture"* condense the soaring mystery of *qi* to form numinous script, unite the Eight Assemblies to compose sound, and harmonize the Five Convergences to complete its chapters. When the great cosmic cycle commences, jade-like tones arise of themselves; divine winds play in emptiness, and the *shao* melodies resound through the caverns. They shine brilliantly above the various heavens, illuminating the depths of the Great Obscurity, evolving in unison with the Dragon Han era and unfolding the Crimson Clarity of the Yan Kang epoch. They refine water and fire within life and death, enduring through kalpas without end, opening the Eight Enclosures at the hidden pivot and planting the numinous radiance within the Great Yang. The Two Modes uphold them to divide [heaven and earth], and the Three Luminaries sustain them to distinguish [time and space]. The exalted sages ride them to ascend in glory; the Five Peaks treasure them for their numinosity. All things attain life through them, and the fortunes of states enjoy peace by their virtue. Vast and boundless is their great model, lofty and revered their supreme dignity. From being arises non-being, and they are the root of heaven and earth. Those who attain them do not die; those who venerate them endure forever. Those who treasure them receive the descent of the Perfected; those who cultivate them become immortals. They deliver the dead from eternal night and refine the living souls in the Vermilion Palace. The wondrous transformative script emerges from spontaneity—blended, it is not turbid; clarified, it is not pure; destroyed, it is not extinguished; extinguished, it revives again. Towering and transcendent above the Great Void, they are the ancestral origin of the myriad emperors. Their majestic numen is vast and boundless, beyond all naming.

---

### *The Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of the Eight Assemblies, Spontaneously Manifested Under the Eastern Bluegreen Emperor*

**Nine *Qi* Governing the Scripts of the Various Heavens**

- **Great Yellow August Layered Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Great Bright Jade Complete Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Clear Bright Harmonious Youth Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Mysterious Womb Level Nurturing Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Primal Bright Literary Flourishing Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Seven Luminaries Majestic Calm Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Void Transcending Balance Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Great Ultimate Veiled Obscurity Heaven**: Thirty-two Five-Colored Jade Lads; Thirty-two Jade Maidens in Embroidered Robes; Thirty-two Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans each.
- **Nine *Qi* Bluegreen Heaven**: Thirty-two Celestial Merit Officers for Ascending as Immortals; Thirty-two Spontaneous Merit Officers for Liberation from Mortality; Thirty-two Spontaneous Merit Officers for Renewed Life; Thirty-two Flying Heavenly Attendant Perfected Clerks; Thirty-two Flying Heavenly Guardian Perfected Clerks; Thirty-two Flying Heavenly Inspector Perfected Envoys; Thirty-two Direct Service Clerks; Thirty-two Transmission and Memorial Clerks; Thirty-two Flying Dragon Rider Clerks.

---

### *The Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of the Eight Assemblies, Spontaneously Manifested Under the Southern Vermilion Emperor*

chunks.original_text: 太岁某年某月某甲子朔某日甲子，某岳真人，本命某，甲子某月生，某天领籍炁系某炁天君，今於某炁天中，从师某岳先生道士某君，受文佩身，七宝镇灵，金缯誓心，告灵盟天，约为身宝，奉承大法，俯仰旧典，上告三十二天监度文命、侍经仙郎、韩司主录、飞天真人、三界神王，落某甲死籍，勒上仙名金格玉箓三元品中，依大囿威仪，降下真仙之气，入某身中。 三十二天监仙司马、典经羽郎，各依格遣玉童玉女神真之气，各一合下侍卫灵文，奉给某甲身，普关诸天诸地无极世界日月星宿三界官属； 五岳名山九江水府三官司罚； 九幽长夜泉曲之中，无影无色，无形无名，无音无响，无大无小，无高无下，无尊无卑一切神灵，咸各明某甲身奉大法，佩带天文，名入仙箓三元品中。 出入游行，依旧伺迎，一日三朝，如紫微上宫，削落地简九幽目录，灭绝宿根，渐息恶缘，不得拘逮，亿劫无连，七祖同福，皆得上升，逍遥玄都七宝林中，魂受炼度，时得更生。 某甲约承奉大法，一如明真捡身慎诚，生死成仙，五帝交友，游戏诸天。 愆盟负誓，泄漏天文，传非年限，生死谢对，长负河源，风刀万劫，镇夜挞山，罪福报对，悉如盟文。 天真皇人曰：受度《诸天内音自然玉字》，当依明真典格，以朱书白素，上赍七宝，镇灵金缯，效心拜黄缯章表，告诸天度文，露於中坛三日三宿，不遇风雨，文不飞扬，合真以传。 诸天内音自然玉字大梵隐语无量洞章玉诀 太黄皇曾天音玉诀第一 东九炁青天八会书音 皇曾天中，第一、第二、第三，三字皆仰书玄都长楼之上。 其文以正天地之度数，主召十方众真大神。 其次第四、第五，二字则书帝君游台南轩之上，主空无之中生自然神真。 其次第六、第七、第八，三字书日月之门，主通九幽之光，开长夜之府。 字皆方一丈，八角焕明，皇曾天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙道，当以月十斋之日，朱书皇曾天中第一、第二、第三三字，向王服之，咒如法。 百日万神朝己。 以月十五、三十日朱书第四、第五二字，向东服之，咒如法。 服之二十四年，神真并生，生死皆得上升帝君游台之上。 以月上下弦望之日，朱书第六、第七、第八三字，向月服之八年。 身内有光，面作金色，生死皆得上升日月之馆，受炼成仙，佩其文，三官无复恶对之录，名书皇曾天中，随运生死，亿劫无穷，其法妙重，飞天齐功。 太明玉完天音玉诀第二 玉完天中第一、第二，二字并书天西北玉阙之上，主天地劫数之期。 其次第三、第四，二字则书三界之门玉扇之上，主始开分度。 其次第五、第六，二字书紫微上馆，主罪福之场，开生死之门。 其次第七、第八，二字书北元玄斗之中，主制天关轮转之度。 天书皆方一丈，八角焕明玉完天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以戊辰、戊戌之日，朱书玉完天中第一、第二二字，向西北方服之，咒如法。 皆得随运生死，劫劫化生，位齐飞天。 以本命之日，朱书第三、第四二字，向本命服之，咒如法。 百日地官削死，三界保仙，生死皆得径升三便之门。 又以甲子之日朱书第五、第六二字，向北服之，咒如上法。 百日三官削落罪簿，上天勒录，於司命曹幽魂，则出长夜之户，受度更生福德之堂。

**Year of the Great Year-Star [Tai Sui], [specific] month, [specific] jiazi day as the new moon, [specific] jiazi day as the appointed day:**

The Perfected of [specific] Sacred Peak, whose natal destiny is [specific], born in the [specific] jiazi month, and whose celestial register is under the jurisdiction of the Qi Sovereign of [specific] Qi Heaven, now in [specific] Qi Heaven, receives the scriptural talisman from Master [specific], the Daoist of [specific] Sacred Peak, to wear upon the body. With the Seven Treasures sealing the spirit, golden silk pledging the heart, and a covenant sworn before the numinous heavens, this talisman is bound as the body’s treasure. Reverently upholding the Great Law, adhering to ancient canons, and petitioning the overseers of the Thirty-Two Heavens—those who monitor the scriptural decrees of salvation, the Attendant Immortal Gentlemen of the Scriptures, Han the Controller of Records, the Flying Heaven Perfected, and the Divine Kings of the Three Realms—[the initiate’s] name is stricken from the register of mortal death and inscribed upon the golden tablets and jade registers of the Three Primordials. In accordance with the majestic rites of the Great Enclosure, the qi of the true immortals descends and enters the initiate’s body.

The Supervisory Immortal Marshals of the Thirty-Two Heavens and the Feathered Gentlemen of the Scriptures, each according to their register, dispatch the qi of jade lads and jade maidens—one portion each—to attend and guard the numinous scripture, bestowing it upon the initiate’s body. This universally binds all heavens, all earths, and the boundless worlds; the sun, moon, and stellar lodges; the officials of the Three Realms; the Five Sacred Peaks, famous mountains, and the water palaces of the Nine Rivers; the Three Officials who mete out punishments; and the spirits of the Nine Darks, the Long Night, and the Yellow Springs—those without shadow or form, without name or sound, without size or stature, without rank or station—all shall clearly recognize that the initiate upholds the Great Law, bears the celestial scripture upon the body, and has a name inscribed in the registers of the Three Primordials. In all goings and comings, they shall attend and welcome as before, thrice daily, as in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace. The earthly writs of the Nine Darks are expunged, the roots of past transgressions severed, and evil affinities gradually dissolved. No restraint or arrest shall befall the initiate; through countless kalpas, no entanglement shall arise. Seven generations of ancestors shall share in this blessing, all ascending to roam freely in the Seven-Treasured Grove of the Mysterious Capital, where souls undergo refinement and salvation, and in due time, attain rebirth.

The initiate pledges to uphold the Great Law, ever mindful of the Perfected’s scrutiny, vigilant in sincerity, to achieve immortality in life and death, befriend the Five Emperors, and wander playfully through the heavens. Should the covenant be broken, the celestial scriptures divulged, or transmission occur outside the proper time, the consequences of life and death shall be faced, and the debt to the River Source shall endure eternally. For ten thousand kalpas, the Wind Blade shall strike nightly upon the mountains. Recompense for transgressions and blessings shall be meted out precisely as sworn in the covenant.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign declares: Upon receiving the *Innate Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of All Heavens*, one must adhere to the canonical standards of the Illuminated Perfected. Inscribe in vermilion upon white silk, present the Seven Treasures, seal the spirit with golden silk, and offer a yellow-silk memorial with reverent devotion. Proclaim the salvific scripture of the heavens, exposing it upon the central altar for three days and nights, unmarred by wind or rain, the scripture undisturbed. Only then may it be transmitted in accordance with the Perfected.

**The Jade Formulae of the Innate Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of All Heavens, the Great Brahmā Concealed Speech, the Ineffable Cavern Scriptures**

**1. The Jade Formula of the Sounds of the Supreme Yellow Sovereign Zeng Heaven**
*The Eightfold Script of the Eastern Nine Qi Azure Heaven*

Within the Sovereign Zeng Heaven, the first, second, and third characters are inscribed facing upward upon the Long Tower of the Mysterious Capital. These scriptures regulate the measurements of heaven and earth and summon the great deities and true beings of the ten directions. The fourth and fifth characters are inscribed upon the southern pavilion of the Emperor Lord’s Wandering Terrace, governing the spontaneous generation of true beings within the Void. The sixth, seventh, and eighth characters are inscribed upon the gates of the sun and moon, governing the illumination of the Nine Darks and the opening of the Long Night’s repository. Each character measures one *zhang* square, resplendent with eight luminous corners, within the Sovereign Zeng Heaven.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign declares: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the tenth-day fast of each month, inscribe in vermilion the first, second, and third characters of the Sovereign Zeng Heaven, face the direction of the King’s attire, and recite the incantation as prescribed. After a hundred days, ten thousand spirits shall pay homage to the self. On the fifteenth and thirtieth days of the month, inscribe in vermilion the fourth and fifth characters, face east, and consume them while reciting the incantation as prescribed. After twenty-four years of this practice, true beings shall be born within, and in life and death, one shall ascend to the Emperor Lord’s Wandering Terrace. On the days of the waxing and waning moon, inscribe in vermilion the sixth, seventh, and eighth characters, face the moon, and consume them for eight years. Light shall emanate from within, the face shall turn golden, and in life and death, one shall ascend to the halls of the sun and moon, undergo refinement, and achieve immortality. Bearing this scripture, the Three Officials shall no longer record transgressions; the name shall be inscribed in the Sovereign Zeng Heaven, and through the cycles of life and death, one shall endure for countless kalpas. Its method is wondrous and profound, its merit equal to that of the Flying Heavens.

**2. The Jade Formula of the Sounds of the Supreme Bright Jade Complete Heaven**

Within the Jade Complete Heaven, the first and second characters are inscribed together upon the northwestern jade gate-tower, governing the epochs of heaven and earth’s kalpas. The third and fourth characters are inscribed upon the jade fan of the Three Realms’ gate, governing the initial division of measurements. The fifth and sixth characters are inscribed upon the Upper Palace of the Purple Tenuity, governing the realm of retribution and the gate of life and death. The seventh and eighth characters are inscribed within the Northern Primordial Mysterious Dipper, governing the regulation of the celestial pivots and the revolutions of the Wheel of Heaven. Each celestial script measures one *zhang* square, resplendent with eight luminous corners, within the Jade Complete Heaven.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign declares: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the days of *wuchen* and *wuxu*, inscribe in vermilion the first and second characters of the Jade Complete Heaven, face the northwest, and consume them while reciting the incantation as prescribed. One shall thereby follow the cycles of life and death, transforming through kalpas, and the rank shall equal that of the Flying Heavens. On the day of one’s natal destiny, inscribe in vermilion the third and fourth characters, face the direction of one’s natal destiny, and consume them while reciting the incantation as prescribed. After a hundred days, the Earth Official shall expunge the register of death, the Three Realms shall safeguard the immortal, and in life and death, one shall ascend directly through the Three Convenient Gates. Furthermore, on the day of *jiazi*, inscribe in vermilion the fifth and sixth characters, face north, and consume them while reciting the incantation as above. After a hundred days, the Three Officials shall strike the name from the ledgers of transgressions, inscribe it in the celestial registers, and for the souls in the Office of Destiny’s dark records, the gates of the Long Night shall open, granting salvation and rebirth in the Hall of Blessings and Virtue.

chunks.original_text: 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，以本命之日，朱书上四字向南服之，身得过度太阳九之灾，驱除之中。 又以月上下弦之日，朱书第五、第六二字，向日月而服之，生死并离时冥，恒处光明，万秽所不能干，妖魅所不能伤。 又以太岁之日，朱书其第七、第八二字，向太岁服之，生死皆得周旋无极世界，不拘五苦之难，逍遥欢乐之中。 竺落皇茄天音玉诀第四 皇茄天中第一、第二，二字并书紫微上宫，主天文开明之期、度人之名。 其第三、第四，二字书北帝寒灵之窗，主万魔之精。 其第五、第六，二字书三便之门，主制云中谣歌之鬼。 其第七、第八，二字书南北二斗之门，主生死功过善恶之名。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明皇笳天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，以春分之日，朱书上二字，向束服之，生死皆得度，入朱陵，受号为仙。 又以立冬之日，朱书第三、第四二字，向东北服之百日，万鬼束形，敢为干试，学道自正，神真自降。 又以八节之日，朱书第五、第六二字，向天门服之，则诵咏朗彻，上闻九天，万魔降伏，道备成仙。 又以五月五日、七月七日，朱书第七、第八二字，向王服之百日，北帝削死籍，南斗书仙名，生死皆得飞天真人。 虚明堂曜天音玉诀第五 堂曜天中第一至第四，四字书玉京九层之台，主飞天真人朝礼之典。 其下四字书南浮洞阳上馆，主诸学者受度之品。 其八字皆方一丈，八角焕明堂曜天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以八节之日，朱书上四字，向王服之，生死皆得上朝玄都之宫，受飞天灌五云之华，而成飞天真人也。 又以五月五日、七月七日，朱书下四字，向南服之，则魂神受炼，气自澄正，八景备守，共举人身，上升玄都之上骞林之中也。 观明端靖天音玉诀第六 端靖天中第一字，书天关之上，主四时之炁。 其第二至第四，三字书北斗玄关之中，主众真朝宴之仪。 其第五、第六，二字书金阙北壁，主制天魔。 其第七、第八，二字书三便之门，主学者应度之人。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明端靖天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以八节之日，朱书上一字，向王服之百日，万灾不能伤，毒疠不敢干，与四时休和，洞明自然。 又以八节之日，朱书第二、第三、第四三字向王服之百日，万神朝门。 又以立冬之日，朱书第五第六二字，向东北服之，万魔降伏，鬼精束形。 又以七月七日朱书第七第八二字，向本命服之，南上书仙名於玉簿，出幽魂於地下，身入法轮之门，游宴开明之户也。 玄明恭庆天音玉诀第七 恭庆天中第一字，书紫微之宫北壁之上，主领万神事。 其第二字书东华宫主制神龙龙王仪典。 其第三、第四、第五、第六，四字书三便之门，主生死图录，总仙度品格。 其第七、第八，二字书南极宫中，主五炁炼度仪典。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明恭庆天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以正旦#1朱书上一字，向束服之，则万神侍卫，威制十方。 又以立春日朱书第二字，向束服之，八年神龙为使。 又以五月五日、七月七日，朱书第三、第四、第五、第六四字，向南服之百日，北帝削死籍，三界度仙品。 又以夏至日朱书第七、第八二字，向南服之百日，面有玉光，万神安镇，五曰#2 结仙。

**Heavenly Perfection Sovereign declares:** To cultivate the Dao of Flying Immortality, on the day of one’s original destiny, inscribe the first four characters in vermilion and face south to ingest them—thus the body transcends the nine calamities of Grand Yang, dispelling all within. On the days of the moon’s waxing and waning, inscribe the fifth and sixth characters in vermilion and face the sun and moon to ingest them—life and death both depart from the darkness of time, ever abiding in radiance, untouched by the myriad defilements, unharmed by demonic spirits. **Zhuluo Huangjia Heaven’s Jade Instructions, Fourth**
In *Huangjia Heaven*, the first and second characters are inscribed together upon the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, governing the celestial patterns’ periods of brilliance and the names of those to be delivered. The third and fourth characters are inscribed upon the North Emperor’s Chilly Numinous Window, governing the essences of the myriad demons. The fifth and sixth characters are inscribed upon the Gate of Three Conveniences, governing the control of the singing ghosts in the clouds. Together, the eight characters are each one *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiant within *Huangjia Heaven*.

**Heavenly Perfection Sovereign declares:** To cultivate the Dao of Flying Immortality, on the Spring Equinox, inscribe the first two characters in vermilion and face east to ingest them—life and death both attain deliverance, entering the Vermilion Mound to receive the title of Immortal. On the Beginning of Winter, inscribe the third and fourth characters in vermilion and face northeast to ingest them for a hundred days—all ghosts bind their forms, none dare to test or disturb; the study of the Dao rectifies itself, and divine perfected beings descend of their own accord. The remaining four characters are inscribed upon the Upper Hall of Southern Floating Cavern Yang, governing the ranks of all learners to be delivered. The eight characters are each one *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiant within *Tangyao Heaven*.

**Contemplative Brilliance Upright Tranquility Heaven’s Jade Instructions, Sixth**
In *Duanjing Heaven*, the first character is inscribed upon the Heavenly Pass, governing the qi of the four seasons. The second through fourth characters are inscribed within the Mysterious Pass of the Northern Dipper, governing the rites of the assembled perfected beings’ audience and feast. The fifth and sixth characters are inscribed upon the northern wall of the Golden Watchtower, governing the control of heavenly demons. On the seventh day of the seventh month, inscribe the seventh and eighth characters in vermilion and face one’s original destiny to ingest them—then the Southern Dipper records the Immortal’s name upon the Jade Register, the dark souls emerge from the earth below, the body enters the Gate of the Dharma Wheel, and wanders in revelry through the Portal of Opening Brilliance.

In *Gongqing Heaven*, the first character is inscribed upon the northern wall of the Purple Tenuity’s Palace, governing the administration of the myriad spirits’ affairs. The second character is inscribed upon the Eastern Florescence Palace, governing the rites of controlling divine dragons and dragon kings. chunks.original_text: 太焕极瑶天音玉诀第八 极瑶天中第一至第四，四字书玉京山七宝台上，主诸真人游行仪典。 其下四字书紫微官中，主生死得道人受仙品目。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明极瑶天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以八节之日，朱书上四字，向王服之，修斋行道，万神侍卫，诵咏朗彻，众真下降。 又以本命之日，朱书下四字，向太岁服之，三官削地简，紫微书名仙录，生死皆得上升玉京之台，逍遥玄都紫微官中。 元载孔升天音玉诀第一 西方七炁素天八会书音 孔升天中，上四字并书南极玄窗之上，主诸得道人受炼品目。 其第五、第六，二字书南极洞阳之馆，主得道人受炼进仙品目。 其第七、第八二字书南上北窗上，主制万魔干试之气。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明孔升天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以五月五日、七月七日朱书上四字，向南服之，身体受津，内外光明，万神镇宫。 又以本命之日，朱书第五、第六二字向本命服之，三官削地箓，南极度仙名。 又以立春之日，朱书第七、第八二字，向北服之，万魔降伏，鬼精灭爽，神真总归，身飞太清。 太安皇崖天音玉诀第二 皇崖天中上二字，书金阙之南，主天地开辟之运。 其第三、第四，二字书大罗之上通真之房，主诸尘秽之气，总得度人名。 其第五以下四字，并书南宫福堂之上，主诸飞天得道人高下品秩。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明皇崖天中。 真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以太岁之日，朱书上二字，向东服之，生死皆得随运往来，光明不绝。 又以八节之日，朱书第三、第四二字，向王服之，万秽清荡，神气澄正，名书朱宫，仙官来迎。 又以七月七日朱书下四字，向南服之，太极度仙品，九灵记福堂，生死皆受自然之厨，欢乐七宝林中。 显定极风天音玉诀第三 极风天中，上二字书月宫之阴，主天王游宴之仪，制月光之散晖。 其第三、第四，二字书玄都紫房，主天地劫会之期。 其下四字并书玉京玄台，主生死录籍善恶功过。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明极风天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以月生三日，朱书上二字，向月服之三百日，面有金容，身有光明。 又以八节之日，朱书其下二字，向西北服之，皆得过大小劫会天地之灾。 又以太岁日朱书其下四字，向本命服之百日，三官主除地简，南宫记仙名。 二十四年，当有#3夕 三色之云，迎子上升景皇之庭，逍遥太无之中，位为景霄真人也。 始皇孝芒天音玉诀第四 孝芒天中上四字，并题南上朱陵之阙，主生死开度善恶缘对赤简之录。 其下四字并题日之上馆，主得度之人受炼之容，披九幽之户，入更生之门。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明孝芒天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以本命之日，朱书上四字，向本命服之百日，九幽削宿简，南宫记仙名，生死灭度，世生福门。 又以月十五日正中，朱书其下四字，向日服之三年，日童下降｀，面有日光，灭度则得受炼而更生，大运满则得驾乘飞景之舆，游於三界之上大寂之庭，七祖同福，世世仙王也。 太黄翁重浮容天音玉诀第五 翁重天中，上二字题玄都九层长楼，主召天中之魔，其第三、第四，二字题三便之门，主制天中魔王谣歌之音。 其下四字题北灵上馆，主治#4万鬼之牢。

**The Jade Formula of the Radiant Ultimate Jade-Sound Heaven, Scroll Eight**

The first through fourth characters of the Supreme Jade Heaven are inscribed upon the Seven Treasures Terrace of Jade Capital Mountain, governing the ceremonial processions of all Perfected Ones. The four characters below are inscribed within the Purple Tenuity Palace, governing the ranks of those who attain the Dao and transcend life and death. When all eight characters are combined, each a zhang in breadth, their eight corners radiate with luminous brilliance in the Supreme Jade Heaven.

The Heavenly Perfected One of the Celestial Truth says: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the days of the eight solar nodes, inscribe the first four characters in vermilion and face the Sovereign to ingest them. Perform purification rites and practice the Dao—then the myriad spirits attend in guard, their recitations resonant and clear, and the host of Perfected Ones descends. On the day of one’s life-star, inscribe the lower four characters in vermilion and face the Year-Star to ingest them—then the Three Bureaus erase the earthly registers, the Purple Tenuity records one’s name in the Immortal Register, and both the living and the dead ascend to the Terrace of Jade Capital, roaming freely within the Mysterious Metropolis of the Purple Tenuity Palace.

---

**The Jade Formula of the Primordial Ascent of the Celestial Sound, Scroll One**
*The Eightfold Script of the Plain Heaven of the Western Seven Qi*

In the Heaven of Ascent, the first four characters are inscribed together above the Mysterious Window of the Southern Culmen, governing the ranks of those who attain the Dao and undergo refinement. The fifth and sixth characters are inscribed within the Cavern-Yang Lodge of the Southern Culmen, governing the advancement of those who attain the Dao and ascend in rank. The seventh and eighth characters are inscribed above the northern window of the southern chamber, governing the qi that subdues the myriad demons’ trials. When all eight characters are combined, each a zhang in breadth, their eight corners radiate with luminous brilliance in the Heaven of Ascent.

The Heavenly Perfected One of the Celestial Truth says: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the fifth day of the fifth month and the seventh day of the seventh month, inscribe the first four characters in vermilion and face south to ingest them—then the body receives divine essence, inner and outer radiance shines forth, and the myriad spirits guard the palace. On the day of one’s life-star, inscribe the fifth and sixth characters in vermilion and face one’s life-star to ingest them—then the Three Bureaus erase the earthly registers, and the Southern Culmen records one’s Immortal name. On the Beginning of Spring, inscribe the seventh and eighth characters in vermilion and face north to ingest them—then the myriad demons submit, ghostly spirits perish, and divine Perfected Ones gather in assembly, while the body soars to the Grand Clarity.

---

**The Jade Formula of the August Cliff of the Celestial Sound, Scroll Two**

In the Heaven of the August Cliff, the first two characters are inscribed south of the Golden Portal, governing the revolutions of heaven and earth’s unfolding. The third and fourth characters are inscribed within the Chamber of Communion with the Perfected atop the Great Veil, governing the qi of all worldly impurities and the register of those delivered. The four characters below are inscribed together above the Blessed Hall of the Southern Palace, governing the high and low ranks of all flying immortals who attain the Dao. When all eight characters are combined, each a zhang in breadth, their eight corners radiate with luminous brilliance in the Heaven of the August Cliff.

The Perfected One of the Celestial Truth says: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the day of the Year-Star, inscribe the first two characters in vermilion and face east to ingest them—then both the living and the dead follow the revolutions to and fro, their radiance unceasing. On the days of the eight solar nodes, inscribe the third and fourth characters in vermilion and face the Sovereign to ingest them—then the myriad impurities are cleansed, the spirit and qi are purified and rectified, names are recorded in the Vermilion Palace, and Immortal officials come to welcome. On the seventh day of the seventh month, inscribe the lower four characters in vermilion and face south to ingest them—then the Supreme Ultimate confers Immortal ranks, the Nine Numinous Ones record blessings in the Blessed Hall, and both the living and the dead receive the natural kitchens, rejoicing in the Seven Treasures Grove.

---

**The Jade Formula of the Radiant Ultimate Wind of the Celestial Sound, Scroll Three**

In the Heaven of Ultimate Wind, the first two characters are inscribed upon the yin side of the Moon Palace, governing the ceremonial feasts of the Heavenly Kings and regulating the scattered radiance of moonlight. The third and fourth characters are inscribed within the Purple Chamber of the Mysterious Metropolis, governing the kalpas of heaven and earth’s conjunctions. The four characters below are inscribed together upon the Mysterious Terrace of Jade Capital, governing the registers of life and death, merits and transgressions. When all eight characters are combined, each a zhang in breadth, their eight corners radiate with luminous brilliance in the Heaven of Ultimate Wind.

The Heavenly Perfected One of the Celestial Truth says: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the third day of the waxing moon, inscribe the first two characters in vermilion and face the moon to ingest them for three hundred days—then the face bears a golden countenance, and the body radiates light. On the days of the eight solar nodes, inscribe the next two characters in vermilion and face the northwest to ingest them—then one transcends the great and small kalpas and the disasters of heaven and earth. On the day of the Year-Star, inscribe the lower four characters in vermilion and face one’s life-star to ingest them for a hundred days—then the Three Bureaus erase the earthly registers, and the Southern Palace records one’s Immortal name. After twenty-four years, there shall be an evening when three-colored clouds welcome you to ascend to the Court of the Radiant August Emperor, roaming freely within the Great Non-Being, where you shall be titled Perfected One of the Radiant Empyrean.

---

**The Jade Formula of the Filial Radiance of the Celestial Sound, Scroll Four**

In the Heaven of Filial Radiance, the first four characters are inscribed together upon the Vermilion Mound Gate of the Southern Culmen, governing the opening and deliverance of life and death, the karmic correspondences of good and evil, and the records of the Red Tablets. The four characters below are inscribed together upon the Upper Lodge of the Sun, governing the refined countenance of those who attain deliverance, unlocking the gates of the Nine Darks and entering the gates of rebirth. When all eight characters are combined, each a zhang in breadth, their eight corners radiate with luminous brilliance in the Heaven of Filial Radiance.

The Heavenly Perfected One of the Celestial Truth says: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortality, on the day of one’s life-star, inscribe the first four characters in vermilion and face one’s life-star to ingest them for a hundred days—then the Nine Darks erase the tablets of past transgressions, the Southern Palace records one’s Immortal name, life and death are extinguished and transcended, and the gates of worldly blessings open. On the fifteenth day of the month at high noon, inscribe the lower four characters in vermilion and face the sun to ingest them for three years—then the Sun Lad descends, the face bears solar radiance, and upon extinction, one undergoes refinement and is reborn. When the great destiny is fulfilled, one shall ride the flying auroral chariot, roaming above the Three Realms in the Court of the Great Stillness, while the seven generations of ancestors share in the blessings, and one becomes an Immortal King for all generations.

---

**The Jade Formula of the Grand Yellow Elder of the Floating Countenance of the Celestial Sound, Scroll Five**

In the Heaven of the Floating Countenance, the first two characters are inscribed upon the Nine-Tiered Long Tower of the Mysterious Metropolis, governing the summoning of demons within heaven. The third and fourth characters are inscribed upon the Gate of the Three Conveniences, governing the regulation of the demon kings’ chants and songs within heaven. The four characters below are inscribed upon the Upper Lodge of the Northern Numinous One, governing the prison of the myriad ghosts.

**The Jade Formula of the Jiang-You Heavenly Sound, Scroll Six**

When the eight characters are combined, each spans a square of one *zhang*, their eight corners radiant and luminous within the Jiang-You Heaven. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortals, one must on days of purification and ritual practice seek transcendence, inscribing in cinnabar the first two characters and ingesting them while facing north—thus demonic trials will not intrude, and true spirits shall descend. On days of entering mountains to supplicate or reciting scriptures, inscribe in cinnabar the third and fourth characters and ingest them while facing northeast—then recitations will ring clear, the heavens echo from afar, the heart-mind will be serene and upright, and after seven years, one attains immortality. When afflicted by nightmares or harmed by the hundred ghosts, inscribe in cinnabar the lower four characters and ingest them while facing northeast—then the myriad ghosts will be bound in form, the Three Officials will seize the demonic, pernicious spirits will daily diminish, divine perfected ones will descend into the body, the revolving of destiny will be fulfilled, and one will ascend to become a Supreme Immortal.

Within the Jiang-You Heaven, the upper four characters are inscribed upon the Jade Towers of the Nine Heavens, governing the qi of the four seasons and determining the reckoning of yin and yang. The lower four characters are inscribed upon the Terrace of Luminous Perfection, governing the register of those who have transcended death and leading those who are reborn. When the eight characters are combined, each spans a square of one *zhang*, their eight corners radiant and luminous within the Jiang-You Heaven. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortals, on the days of the eight solar nodes, inscribe in cinnabar the upper four characters and ingest them while facing the sovereign—thus one will merge with the qi of the four seasons, naturally passing through calamities unscathed and treading upon harm uninjured. On the day of one’s life-destiny, inscribe in cinnabar the lower four characters and ingest them while facing one’s life-destiny—then the Nine Dark Realms will erase one’s record from the earthly ledgers, and one’s name of rebirth will be inscribed in the Southern Sunlight; the seven generations of ancestors will share in the blessings and forever enter the Hall of Joyous Delight.

**The Jade Formula of the Ruan-Le Heavenly Sound, Scroll Seven**

Within the Ruan-Le Heaven, the first two characters are inscribed upon the Northern Terrace of the Purple Tenuity, governing the ranks of those who attain the immortal Way. The third, fourth, and fifth characters are inscribed upon the Terrace of Southern Sunlight, governing the review of the records of the Dark Night, the deliverance of reborn souls, their ascent to the Vermilion Mound’s lodges, where clothing and sustenance arise spontaneously, and they dwell in the Hall of Fortune. The lower three characters are inscribed upon the Terrace of Primordial Yang above the Great Veil, governing the deliverance of those of the highest rank across the thousandfold worlds, their ascent to the Hall of No Shadow. When the eight characters are combined, each spans a square of one *zhang*, their eight corners radiant and luminous within the Ruan-Le Heaven. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: To cultivate the Way of Flying Immortals, on the first day of the new year, inscribe in cinnabar the first two characters and ingest them while facing east—after a hundred days, the Eastern Florescence will record one’s name among the ranks of the Supreme Immortals. On the seventh day of the seventh month at the hour of the cock’s crow, inscribe in cinnabar the lower three characters and ingest them while facing north—then the Nine Dark Realms will erase the records of the Long Night, the Southern Palace will inscribe the names of the reborn, and the nine generations of ancestors will depart the Five Sufferings, ascending to the Hall of Blessed Felicity within the Mysterium. On the days of the eight solar nodes, inscribe in cinnabar the lower three characters and ingest them while facing the sovereign—then all who have transcended death will ascend above the Great Veil, roaming freely within the Seven Jeweled Grove.

**The Jade Formula of the Tan-Shi Heavenly Sound, Scroll Eight**

Within the Tan-Shi Heaven, the upper six characters are collectively inscribed upon the Azure Grove Lodge of the Eastern Florescence Palace, governing the spontaneous sounds that arise naturally in the heavens. The lower two characters are inscribed upon the Jade Terrace of the Mysterious Metropolis, governing the perfected ones’ ingestion of the essence of the five clouds and the radiance of the sun and moon. When the eight characters are combined, each spans a square of one *zhang*, their eight corners radiant and luminous within the Tan-Shi Heaven. chunks.original_text: 馆，其次二字书东井华林之堂，主洪水四出，盈缩之度。 其下第五、第六、第七、第八，四字并书太极宫中，主大水出时，司命校录，度学仙之人。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明元洞天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以冬至后甲子日，朱书上四字，向北服之，二十四年，则能水行，河伯伺迎，万灵侍卫，天灾不伤也。 又以朱书下四字佩身，则名参帝录，生死为仙。 大水出#6时朱书，北向服之，则乌母迎以凤辈，上登昆仑#7之山，逍遥游观洪波之津也。 太文翰宠妙成天音玉诀第三 妙成天中，上二字书月之上馆，主明天地之阴阳，通长夜之光。 其第三、第四，二字书三便之门，主生死之籍，度得道之人。 其第五、第六、第七、第八，四字书紫微云宫，主生死得度之人，羽服飞行之仪。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明妙成天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以月生三日，朱书上二字，向月再拜而吞之，七年身内发明，昭见五内。 又以八节日，朱书其第三、第四二字，向王服之，皆得度大会之灾，身为圣王之民，五帝保举，位列仙王。 又以八节日朱书#8其下四字，向王服之，生死皆得上诣朱陵，受仙衣羽服而游诸天也。 太素秀乐禁上天音玉诀第四 禁上天中第一、第二，二字书玉台之上，主空洞自然之书。 其第三、第四，二字书三便之门，主生死图籍，试得道之人。 其第五、第六、第七、第八，四字书紫微长楼，主总监诸天气，主得道人升迁之名。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明禁上天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以正旦朱书上二字，向王服之，身与四时节候相应，诵咏灵音，上参晨霄。 又以七月七日中时，朱书第三、第四二字，向本命服之百日，北帝削死箓，南宫上仙籍，魔王保举，生死得道也。 又以八节之日，朱书其下四字，向王服之，七祖八年皆得上升朱陵之府，身与诸天同友，交游上清也。 太虚元上常融天音玉诀第五 常融天中，上四字书紫微上宫通阳之馆，主得度之人功德轻重之品。 其下四字书天北元玄斗之中，主炼度得道人身，以迁自然之堂。 合八字，皆 方一丈，八角焕明常融天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以七月七日，朱书上四字，向王服之百日，三界书其功名，名上#9朱陵之府，七年位为真人。 又以正旦朱书其下四字，东向服之，生死皆受自然，光明去离九幽之根，升入无极福堂也。 太释玉隆腾胜天音玉诀第六 玉隆天中，上四字书玉清云宫，主众圣上朝之仪典，主云霞而聚云也。 其下四字书紫阳上馆，主自然之音，和空洞之章。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明玉隆天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以八节之日，平旦、正中、日入三时，朱书上四字，向王服之百日，万神朝己。 二十四年则致碧霞之辈，上升七宝云宫。 又以八节日正中，朱书其下四字，向王服之八年，则能自然知诸天之音，洞达玄虚，与道合同也。 龙变梵度天音玉诀第七 梵度天中，上二字书紫微太虚之馆，主度得道上升之人。 其下六字，并书南阳上官紫台之轩，主得道功勋轻重之叔。 合八字，皆方一丈，八角焕明梵度天中。 天真皇人曰：修飞仙之道，当以正旦朱书上二字，向王服之八年，朱宫书名，飞天同功。

Within the Primordial Grotto Heaven, the first two characters are inscribed upon the Fusang’s Office of Numinous Governance; the next two characters are inscribed upon the Hall of Hua-Lin in the Eastern Well, governing the ebb and flow of the Great Floods. The fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth characters are all inscribed within the Supreme Ultimate Palace, governing the timing of the Great Flood’s emergence, where the Controller of Destinies examines and records those who study the Dao of flight as immortals. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Primordial Grotto Heaven.

The Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Perfection states: To cultivate the Dao of flight as immortals, on the *jiazi* day following the winter solstice, inscribe the first four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing north—after twenty-four years, one will be able to traverse water, where the River Earl awaits in attendance, myriad spirits serve as guards, and no celestial calamity can harm one. If the lower four characters are inscribed in cinnabar and worn on the body, one’s name will be recorded in the Emperor’s register, and in life and death, one will become an immortal. When the Great Flood emerges, inscribe the characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing north—then the Dark Mother will welcome one with a phoenix retinue, ascending Kunlun’s peaks to roam and observe the vast waves’ ford.

**The Jade Formula of the Wondrously Accomplished Heavenly Sound, Third Scroll**

Within the Wondrously Accomplished Heaven, the first two characters are inscribed upon the Upper Chamber of the Moon, governing the illumination of heaven and earth’s yin and yang, and the transmission of light through the long night. The third and fourth characters are inscribed upon the Gate of the Three Conveniences, governing the registers of life and death, and the deliverance of those who attain the Dao. The fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth characters are inscribed within the Purple Tenuity Cloud Palace, governing those delivered from life and death, and the rites of feathered robes and flight. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Wondrously Accomplished Heaven.

The Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Perfection states: To cultivate the Dao of flight as immortals, on the third day of the waxing moon, inscribe the first two characters in cinnabar, bow twice toward the moon, and ingest them—after seven years, one’s inner body will become luminous, and the five viscera will be clearly visible. On the days of the eight solar terms, inscribe the third and fourth characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing the Sovereign—thus one will transcend the great calamities of assembly, become a subject of the Sage King, be recommended by the Five Thearchs, and rank among the Immortal Kings. On the days of the eight solar terms, inscribe the lower four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing the Sovereign—then in life and death, one will ascend to the Vermilion Mound, receive the feathered robes of immortals, and wander through the heavens.

The fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth characters are inscribed within the Purple Tenuity Long Tower, governing the oversight of all heavenly *qi* and the promotion of those who attain the Dao. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Forbidden Upper Heaven.

On the seventh day of the seventh month at noon, inscribe the third and fourth characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing one’s life-star for a hundred days—then the Northern Thearch will erase one’s name from the register of death, the Southern Palace will inscribe one in the immortal roster, and the Demon King will act as guarantor, ensuring deliverance in life and death. On the days of the eight solar terms, inscribe the lower four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing the Sovereign—after eight years, one’s seven ancestors will all ascend to the Vermilion Mound’s precincts, and one’s body will befriend the heavens, roaming the Supreme Clarity.

**The Jade Formula of the Grand Void’s Primordial Upper Constant Union Heavenly Sound, Fifth Scroll**

Within the Constant Union Heaven, the first four characters are inscribed upon the Yang-Pervading Chamber of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, governing the ranks of merit and virtue for those delivered. The lower four characters are inscribed within the Northern Celestial Primordial Dipper, governing the refinement and deliverance of the bodies of those who attain the Dao, elevating them to the Hall of Spontaneity. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Constant Union Heaven.

The Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Perfection states: To cultivate the Dao of flight as immortals, on the seventh day of the seventh month, inscribe the first four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing the Sovereign for a hundred days—then the Three Realms will record one’s merits, one’s name will ascend to the Vermilion Mound’s precincts, and after seven years, one will attain the rank of Perfected. On New Year’s Day, inscribe the lower four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing east—then in life and death, one will receive spontaneity, the radiant light will sever the roots of the Nine Darks, and one will ascend into the Hall of Infinite Blessings.

---

**The Jade Formula of the Jade Exaltation’s Soaring Victory Heavenly Sound, Sixth Scroll**

Within the Jade Exaltation Heaven, the first four characters are inscribed upon the Jade Clarity Cloud Palace, governing the ceremonial rites of the assembled sages’ audience, and the gathering of clouds and mist. The lower four characters are inscribed upon the Upper Chamber of Purple Yang, governing the spontaneous sounds and harmonizing the chapters of the Hollow Cavern. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Jade Exaltation Heaven.

Moreover, on the seventh day of the seventh month, inscribe the lower six characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing south for twenty-four years—then one will naturally comprehend the karmic roots of one’s former lives and past existences, and both in life and death ascend to the Heaven of Jade Purity, the Palace of Joy.

**The Jade Formula of the Celestial Sounds of the Supreme Ultimate’s Nurturing Brilliance, Eighth Chapter**

Within the Heaven of Nurturing Brilliance, the upper four characters are inscribed upon the Terrace of the Supreme Ultimate in the Upper Palace of Jade Purity, governing the appellation of the spontaneously generated true being within the Void. The lower four characters are inscribed upon the Gate of the Mysterious Female in the Northern Portal, governing the refinement and deliverance of those who attain the Dao through the qi of the Six Brahmans. When all eight characters are combined, each a square *zhang* in size, their eight corners radiate brilliance throughout the Heaven of Nurturing Brilliance.

The Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Perfection states: To cultivate the Dao of flight as immortals, on New Year’s Day, inscribe the upper four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing east for nine years—then one will sit and perceive the affairs of the natural Void, and one’s name will be recorded in the ranks of the immortal registers by the Supreme Ultimate. Furthermore, on the day of the Beginning of Winter, inscribe the lower four characters in cinnabar and ingest them while facing north for a hundred days—then the six palaces will receive the true, and the body will generate radiant light. After twenty-four years, both in life and death, one will ascend to roam above the Great Veil, carefree within the Grove of the Seven Treasures.

The Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Perfection states: In cultivating the Dao of flight as immortals, the method of deliverance and transcendence—whether through corpse liberation, concealed transformation, or the revolving cycles of life and death—allows one to wander freely without constraint beneath the Great Yin. One should inscribe the boundless inner sounds of the jade characters of the various heavens in cinnabar, wear white silk upon the body, and ingest the texts in accordance with their script. If the heart remains unstained by defilement, the five viscera will be harmoniously pure, the six palaces tranquil and still, and the mind empty and devoid of action. After eight years, one will penetrate the mysteries of all heavens, sit and perceive the ten directions, and the divine immortals will descend in communion. The body will generate jade-like radiance, and one will ride upon a dragon-drawn chariot to ascend at dawn. The jade script will ascend to the Dao, transmitted but once in forty thousand kalpas.

The method of cultivation must adhere to the above cinnabar inscriptions, following the seasonal nodes. During the spring months of the first, second, and third lunar months, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the Sovereign, and knock the teeth nine times while reciting the incantation:

*Great Brahma of the Flying Heavens,*
*Vairocana of the Eight Directions.*
*Azure Heaven of the Nine Qi,*
*All become divine kings.*
*The Five Unions and Eight Assemblies,*
*Flow and radiate through the Great Void.*
*Above, they open the Dragon Han,*
*Ancestors of gods and immortals.*
*Below, they deliver the long night,*
*Chambers of the Nine Dark Realms.*
*Liberating suffering souls,*
*Decayed bones generate light.*
*The body transforms into feathers,*
*Clad in five-colored garments.*
*Azure dragons and green ranks,*
*Striding through the air in flight.*
*Today, I proclaim to the heavens,*
*As the Azure Yang begins.*
*May all wishes harmonize,*
*And unite with the qi as one.*
*Ascend into the formless,*
*Eternally preserved without end.*

Upon completion, ingest the text and swallow the eight qi while facing upward.

During the summer months of the fourth, fifth, and sixth lunar months, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the Sovereign, and knock the teeth three times while reciting the incantation:

*Celestial script unfurls the net,*
*Brahma conduct in the Crimson Clarity.*

*The Void Yang refines the essence.*
*The jade script radiates brilliance,*
*The Three Luminaries illuminate themselves.*
*Below, it delivers life and death,*
*All who receive form.*
*Today is most auspicious,*
*As the Great Sage descends to the court.*
*The windows of the Nine Dark Realms open,*
*The chambers of the dark realms grow bright and clear.*
*The Three Evils cease,*
*My Dao naturally fulfills itself.*
*The Five Thearchs protect and deliver,*
*Ascending to the Capital of Splendor.*
*Within the Grove of the Seven Treasures,*
*One eternally enjoys the lifespan of kalpas.*

Upon completion, ingest the text and swallow the eight breaths while facing upward.

chunks.original_text: 秋七月、八月、九月，当朱书文，向王叩齿七通，咒日： 飞玄八会，结炁成真。 六十四字，总灵天根。 开度生死，朽骨还人。 幽魂披散，受炁上玄。 今日时庆，万愿开陈。 众真交会，我愿成仙。 景与道合，我愿我神。 得乘素云，上升帝晨。 七宝欢乐，交友真人。 毕，服文仰咽八炁止。 冬十月、十一月、十二月，当朱书文，向王叩齿五通，咒曰： 玉字开明，流焕上门。 八炁结真，梵行景云。 神王启光，三象洞分。 五色徘徊，照我灵魂。 今日值合，仰希帝君。 开有出书，授我真文。 玉泽交灌，五府生熏。 毛羽变化，驾景乘晨。 出有入无，仙度自然。 七祖同归，欢乐上元。 毕，服文，仰咽八炁止。 天真皇人曰：此咒说之辞，皆四会之炁，八和之音，自然之章。 行之者上天遥唱，三界设礼，万神冠带，侍卫灵文也。 随节服御咒说，咽炁百日，诸天记录，地官削简。 八年神真自降，体生玉光，洞达幽灵，坐睹自然，死尸更生，返月还人，轮转不灭，生死得仙，道尊夫妙，四万劫一传。 轻泄漏慢，身负河源，风刀万劫，终不得仙，明真有格，宜秘之焉。 太上洞玄灵宝谖天内音自然玉字卷之二 #1 正旦：原误作「正日」，据敦煌本改。 #2 敦煌本无「五日」二字。 疑系衍文。 #3 当有：敦煌本作「帝以」。 #4 主治：敦煌本作「主召」。 #5 扉：原作「扇」，据敦煌本改。 #6「出」 字据敦煌本补。 #7 昆仑：敦煌本作「须弥」。 #8 「朱书」二字据敦煌本补。 #9 名上：敦煌本作「言上」。 #10 「之」字据敦煌本补。 #11 「七宝」二字据敦煌本补。 #12 拔：敦煌本作「披」。 太上洞玄灵宝诸天内音自然玉字卷之三 大梵隐语无量洞章 元始天尊时与五老上帝、十方大圣众，无极至真诸君丈人，同於赤明世界栢陵舍，坐香林园之中长桑之下。 天尊回驾，诸天降席，是时云雾郁勃，四景冥合，三日三夜。 玄阴不解，天地无光，有如龙汉之前，幽幽冥冥。 五老上帝，前进作礼，上白天尊：今日侍座，所未尝经。 天尊出游，则诸天倾驾，上帝高真、神仙玉女，日月星宿、纵玑玉衡，三界官属，五岳神仙、河海水帝，一切神灵，莫不振肃，侍卫天真。 当时天朗气清，风不摇条，地无飞尘，河海静默，山岳藏烟，时和气定，使生死同欢。 而闭天光明，白日阴冥，天人惶怖，四座不宁，不审何故，所缘如是，愿垂告诲，令众见明，饶益一切，普得安全。 天尊告曰：今日同坐，欢乐难遇，诸天发瑞，灵应自然，玉字焕烂，障蔽天光，未通之始，致如昼冥，日庆时合，希所尝有。 今当普为四众开天妙瑞，度一切人，咸令四座闭目伏地。 於是诸天圣众同时闭眼，伏地听命。 俄顷之间，天气朗除，冥腌豁消，五色光明，洞彻五方，忽然有天书字方一丈，自然而见空玄之上五色光中。 文采焕烂，八角垂芒，精光乱眼，不可得看。 天尊普问四座大众：灵书八会，字无正形，其趣宛奥，难可寻详，天既降应，妙道宜明，便可注笔，解其正音，使皇道既畅，泽被十方。 天真皇人稽首作礼，上白天尊：自随运生化，展转亿劫，屡经侍座，未有今日遭值圣道，开诸法门，得见天书，自然至真。 斯八会之气，合五和之音，非愚情短思所能洞明。

In the autumn months of the seventh, eighth, and ninth moons, inscribe the text in vermilion, face the sovereign, and knock the teeth seven times. Recite the incantation:

*The Flying Mystery gathers in Eight Assemblies,*
*Binding qi to form the True.*
*Sixty-four characters,*
*Encompass the root of the numinous heavens.*
*Opening the deliverance from life and death,*
*Rotten bones return to humanity.*
*Wandering souls scatter and disperse,*
*Receiving qi to ascend to the Mysterious.*
*Today’s time is most auspicious,*
*A myriad wishes unfold.*
*All Perfected gather in assembly,*
*My wish to attain immortality is fulfilled.*
*Radiance merges with the Dao,*
*My wish for my spirit is granted.*
*To ride the plain clouds,*
*Ascending to the imperial dawn.*
*In the joy of the Seven Treasures,*
*To befriend the Perfected Ones.*

Upon completion, ingest the text and swallow the eight breaths while facing upward.

In the winter months of the tenth, eleventh, and twelfth moons, inscribe the text in vermilion, face the sovereign, and knock the teeth five times. Recite the incantation:

*The jade script unfolds its brilliance,*
*Flowing radiance enters the upper gate.*
*Eight qi bind the True,*
*Brahmā-conduct rides the luminous clouds.*
*The Divine King awakens its light,*
*The Three Images clearly divide.*
*Five colors swirl and linger,*
*Illuminating my numinous soul.*
*Today’s convergence is most felicitous,*
*I gaze upward in hope of the Imperial Lord.*
*Opening the celestial register,*
*Bestowing upon me the true script.*
*Jade moisture washes and irrigates,*
*The Five Palaces generate fragrance.*
*Feathers and plumage transform,*
*Mounting radiance to ride the dawn.*
*Exiting existence, entering non-existence,*
*Immortal deliverance arises naturally.*
*Seven ancestors return together,*
*Rejoicing in the Upper Prime.*

Upon completion, ingest the text and swallow the eight breaths while facing upward.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign Lord said: These incantations are the words of the Four Assemblies’ qi and the Eight Harmonies’ sounds, the spontaneous chapters. Those who practice them will have the heavens chant from afar, the Three Realms prepare rites, and the myriad spirits don their regalia to attend and guard the numinous script. Following the seasonal observances, reciting the incantations and swallowing qi for a hundred days, the heavens will record it, and the earthly officials will erase the transgressions. After eight years, the divine Perfected will descend of their own accord, the body will generate jade light, and one will penetrate the dark and numinous, sitting to behold the spontaneous. The dead corpse revives, returning to humanity with the moon’s renewal, revolving without extinction, attaining immortality through life and death. The Dao is most wondrous and exalted, transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas. Those who lightly disclose or neglect it will bear the burden of the river’s source, suffering the wind-blade for ten thousand kalpas, never attaining immortality. The Perfected have set the rules; it is fitting to keep this secret.

---

The Most High Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure, *The Heavenly Inner Sounds of the Spontaneous Jade Script*, Scroll Two

---

The Great Brahmā’s Hidden Language, the Immeasurable Cavernous Chapters

At that time, the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning was seated with the Five Venerable Thearchs, the great sagely hosts of the ten directions, and the boundless perfected lords and elders in the Cypress Mound Lodge within the Crimson Clarity World, beneath the Long Mulberry in the Fragrant Grove Garden. As the Celestial Worthy turned his carriage, the hosts of heaven descended from their seats. Then clouds and mist surged thickly, the four directions darkened, and for three days and nights, the mysterious yin did not disperse, heaven and earth lost their light, as if before the Dragon Han—a profound and obscure gloom.

The Five Venerable Thearchs stepped forward, made obeisance, and addressed the Celestial Worthy: "Today, as we attend your seat, we have never before experienced such a thing. When the Celestial Worthy departs, the hosts of heaven overturn their carriages, the divine and sagely thearchs, the jade maidens, the sun, moon, and stars, the pivot and jade balance, the officials of the Three Realms, the immortals of the Five Peaks, the water thearchs of rivers and seas—all spirits without exception—stand in solemn reverence, attending the Heavenly Perfected. Yet now the heavens are bright and the air clear, the wind does not stir the branches, the earth is free of flying dust, rivers and seas are still, mountains and peaks conceal their mists, the time is harmonious and the qi settled, causing the living and the dead to rejoice together. But the celestial light is obscured, the daylight grows dim, the heavenly beings are alarmed, and the assembly is uneasy. We do not know the reason for this, nor why it has come to pass. We humbly beseech your instruction, that all may see the light, and all beings universally attain peace."

The Celestial Worthy replied: "Today, as we sit together, such joy is rarely encountered. The heavens emit auspicious signs, and the numinous responses arise spontaneously. The jade script shines brilliantly, veiling the celestial light. At the beginning of its transmission, this causes the daylight to darken—a rare and auspicious convergence. Now, for the sake of the four assemblies, I shall reveal the wondrous celestial portent, delivering all beings. Let all in the assembly close their eyes and prostrate themselves upon the earth."

Thereupon, the sagely hosts of heaven simultaneously closed their eyes and prostrated themselves to receive the command. In an instant, the celestial qi cleared, the gloom dissipated, and five-colored light illuminated the five directions. Suddenly, a celestial script of characters a *zhang* square appeared spontaneously in the empty mystery above, within the five-colored light. Its radiance shone brilliantly, eight rays trailing from its corners, its luminous essence dazzling the eyes, making it impossible to gaze upon.

The Celestial Worthy addressed the great assembly: "The numinous script of the Eight Assemblies has no fixed form; its meaning is profound and obscure, difficult to fathom. Since heaven has bestowed this response, the wondrous Dao should be made clear. Now, take up your brushes and interpret its true sounds, so that the imperial Dao may flow freely, and its blessings extend to the ten directions."

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign Lord bowed his head, made obeisance, and addressed the Celestial Worthy: "Since following the turning of the kalpas through countless eons, I have repeatedly attended your seat, yet never before have I encountered such an occasion—witnessing the opening of the dharma gates and beholding the celestial script, the spontaneous and utmost real. This qi of the Eight Assemblies harmonizes with the Five Harmonies’ sounds, beyond the capacity of foolish thoughts and shallow reflections to fully comprehend."
